name: Ravi Saxena
tagline: AI Product Manager | Creative Technologist | Innovator in Generative and Agentic AI
subheading: From managing global IT incidents to building AI-driven workflows and creative products for the future.
homeIntro: Hi, I'm Ravi Saxena — a product thinker, technologist, and creative builder driven by curiosity. From managing global IT incidents to crafting AI-powered workflows and digital experiences, I've spent the last decade turning complexity into clarity. I now focus on building AI-driven products, helping companies reimagine what's possible when human creativity meets machine intelligence.

about.title: From Incident Management to AI Product Innovation
about.summary: 12+ years experience in IT Operations, Incident Management, and Client Success. Transitioning into AI Product Management with hands-on experience in generative and agentic AI tools like n8n, ComfyUI, Cursor, LangChain. Passionate about blending technology, creativity, and human-centric AI systems.
about.storyMd:
My operational leadership equipped me with **systems thinking and stakeholder management** skills that translate perfectly to product management. My fascination with **AI-driven automation and agentic systems** drives my current focus on building intelligent products.

I combine technical execution with creative strategy, designing solutions that are both intelligent and intuitive. Currently focused on **agentic AI systems** — building products that think, react, and collaborate like humans.

**Personal interests** include photography, AI-assisted faceless videos, and embedded system tinkering that fuel my creativity and technical problem-solving approach.
personalStory: I love to talk, laugh, and meet new people.
Coffee fan. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
I'm a big fan of the 90s.
But I'm loyal to my era.
But more of my life is ahead.

workTraits.description: I don't know it all, but I'm happy to learn and grow in my career and as a human being!
As a critical thinker, when problems arise, I always try to figure out the best course of action!
I personally think this is a key part of being a good team player and a leader.
I'm always thinking of how we can move projects forward and what's next.
I take full ownership of my work and see it through to the finish line.
